Welcome UMBC! Designed with you the Fine Art reviewer in mind, Beginnings functions as both my online portfolio, resume, and HTML testing ground. Because my work is primarily done on a computer, and because of my general distrust of computer printers of the caliber that I have access to, I decided to create this web page in addition to printing and mounting individual pieces of hardcopy. The bio page functions as my essay of artistic intent as well as an introduction to my history.

I had hoped to have all work uploaded by the review date but because of certain technical difficulties I was unable to get my video work digitized and had to resort to clumsy VHS. On this tape you will find three individual segments completed during my course work at Frederick Community College. These three video projects all aired over the course the last semester on Frederick Cablevision channel 23. They are described as follows.

1. "College of the Air" - This is a commercial for FCC's cable televised classes. Borrowing the basic concept from Joe Osmann, the video instructor, I wrote the storyboard, filmed, directed, and edited the piece. Starring Pete Backus, another student in the class, and lit by J.R. Voltaglio. The commercial was assembled on a Hi-8 linear deck and then broght into a Media 100 for final tweaking. Here, I was able to add the backgroun music and better sync the voice-overs. The music heard in the back of both this commercial, and the 3rd clip, "Kids on Campus" is from my band, Curious Yellow, in which I play guitar.

2. "FCC Cable 23 News" On this clip, I operated a studio quality three-chip cammera with a Hi-8 deck and monitored the sound of the interview portion. This clip was edited by the talent, Lisa Sweet.

3. "Kids on Campus" - My final news piece at FCC, again featuring Curious Yellow, I produced, directed, filmed, and edited this segment. Eric Corbin, another FCC student, filmed many of the student shots while I was filming the pottery class. Besides that, I had complete control from start to finnish and edited the entire thing on FCC's Media 100, allowing me to add titles and graphics. I also set up the lighting, set, and cameras for the interview segments.

Grant Stavely
